title: UK film industry’s star is rising, but we must ensure Brexit is not the final curtain
text:
The UK’s burgeoning film sector will not be entirely cushioned from the ramifications of a no-deal Brexit but is certainly well-placed to withstand them.

As the curtain lifted last week on the 2019 London Film Festival, British big screen has scarcely been in a better place. The festival – which opened with a Dickens (The Personal History of David Copperfield) and closes with a De Niro (The Irishman) – is a calendar highlight but in truth cinema audiences are being treated all-year round to blockbusters that are increasingly filmed across the UK.
